    • Method Detail

      • getNoArgConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> getNoArgConstructor(Class<T> clazz)
        Throw an IllegalStateException if the class does not have a no-arg constructor.

      • getConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> getConstructor(Class<T> clazz,
                                Class<?>... args)
        Gets a constructor that has the specified types of arguments. Throw an IllegalStateException if the class does not have such a constructor.

      • isOfInterest

        public static boolean isOfInterest(Field field)
        Determine if we should create a Property for the field. Things we ignore: static, final, @Ignore, synthetic

      • isOfInterest

        public static boolean isOfInterest(Method method)
        Determine if we should create a Property for the method (ie, @AlsoLoad)

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> clazz)
        Checked exceptions are LAME. By the way, don't use this since it causes security exceptions on private classes

      • newInstance

        public static <T> T newInstance(Constructor<T> ctor,
                Object... params)
        Checked exceptions are LAME.

      • field_get

        Checked exceptions are LAME.

      • field_set

        public static void field_set(Field field,
             Object obj,

        Checked exceptions are LAME.

      • getProperties

        public static List<Property> getProperties(ObjectifyFactory fact,
                           Class<?> clazz)
        Get all the persistable fields and methods on a class, checking the superclasses as well.
        Returns:
        the fields we load and save, including @Id and @Parent fields. All fields will be set accessable and returned in order starting with superclass fields.

      • getDeclaredField

        public static Field getDeclaredField(Class<?> clazz,
                     String fieldName)
                              throws NoSuchFieldException
        A recursive version of Class.getDeclaredField, goes up the hierarchy looking
        Throws:
        NoSuchFieldException

      • isAssignableFrom

        public static boolean isAssignableFrom(Class<?> to,
                       Class<?> from)
        Just like Class.isAssignableFrom(), but does the right thing when considering autoboxing.

      • getAnnotation

        public static <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> annotationType,
                                     Annotation[] annotations)
        Gets the annotation that has the specified type, or null if there isn't one

      • getAnnotation

        public static <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> annotationType,
                                     Property prop,
                                     Class<?> onClass)
        Checks both the annotations list and the annotations on the class for the type
        Returns:
        null if annotation is not in list or on class.
